notes: PFBS at Lake Pleasant Parkway; reservoir-specific detection, non-detect in main canal; cybo-aquatic PFBS node for GAC/IX treatment
Multiple impaired reaches; priority for riparian buffers and mechanical skimmers to reduce pathogen loads
Estimated mixed debris inflow from storm drains; design target for recycled-plastic racks and floating booms
Projected annual CO2 avoided by electrifying a primary solid-waste route using magnetic-concrete inductive segments
Existing basin-scale salinity control used as upper envelope for local Phoenix/SRP salinity and nutrient offset targets
Phoenix flags CAP-Lake Pleasant source as high risk; motivates cybo-aquatic PFAS/nutrient early-warning and treatment
Modeled TP/TN reduction from combined buffers, fencing, and wetlands; cybo-aquatic node for bacteria and nutrient mitigation
Low-head hydro generation at canal drop powering local pumps and sensors for cybo-aquatic filtration modules
Trail-based monitoring shows elevated E. coli; recreational node for signage, real-time advisories, and buffer targeting
Aggregated EcoNet Karma from PFBS, E. coli, nutrients, debris, CO2, and salinity reductions via cybo-aquatic and energy nodes
